Boros Mastiff.name: Boros Mastiff
Boros Mastiff.text: Battalion — Whenever Boros Mastiff and at least two other creatures attack, Boros Mastiff gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

Haazda Snare Squad.flavor: They've been probation officers, army grunts, bounty hunters—anything to make their district safer.
Haazda Snare Squad.name: Haazda Snare Squad
Haazda Snare Squad.text: Whenever Haazda Snare Squad attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, tap target creature an opponent controls.

Lyev Decree.flavor: The Azorius have so many codes and statutes that you're always in violation of one of them.
Lyev Decree.name: Lyev Decree
Lyev Decree.text: Detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)

Maze Sentinel.flavor: The route has been known for millennia, but only by those with no means to tell it.
Maze Sentinel.name: Maze Sentinel
Maze Sentinel.text:
Vigilance
Multicolored creatures you control have vigilance.

Renounce the Guilds.flavor: "Scores will die in the name of peace. That is what you call compromise?" —Gideon Jura, to Aurelia
Renounce the Guilds.name: Renounce the Guilds
Renounce the Guilds.text: Each player sacrifices a multicolored permanent.

Riot Control.flavor: "Ravnicans need order. If they don't have it, we shall bring it to them." —Isperia
Riot Control.name: Riot Control
Riot Control.text: You gain 1 life for each creature your opponents control. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

Scion of Vitu-Ghazi.name: Scion of Vitu-Ghazi
Scion of Vitu-Ghazi.text: When Scion of Vitu-Ghazi enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

Steeple Roc.flavor: "Sometimes it forgets to loosen its grip before taking flight. I lost my roof that way." —Ecaban, Boros scout
Steeple Roc.name: Steeple Roc

Sunspire Gatekeepers.flavor: "You will pass with respect, or you will not pass at all."
Sunspire Gatekeepers.name: Sunspire Gatekeepers
Sunspire Gatekeepers.text: When Sunspire Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.

Wake the Reflections.flavor: "You see a bird, an oak, a packbeast. I see the potential for an army." —Lalia, Selesnya dryad
Wake the Reflections.name: Wake the Reflections
Wake the Reflections.text: Populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

Aetherling.name: Aetherling
Aetherling.text:
{U}: Exile Aetherling. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
{U}: Aetherling can't be blocked this turn.
{1}: Aetherling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Aetherling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

Hidden Strings.name: Hidden Strings
Hidden Strings.text:
You may tap or untap target permanent, then you may tap or untap another target permanent.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

Maze Glider.flavor: The pattern of the Implicit Maze extends in more than two dimensions.
Maze Glider.name: Maze Glider
Maze Glider.text:
Flying
Multicolored creatures you control have flying.

Mindstatic.flavor: "It's always satisfying to stymie the best efforts of a rival, but the reactions of the Gruul are particularly amusing." —Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker
Mindstatic.name: Mindstatic
Mindstatic.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {6}.

Murmuring Phantasm.flavor: "The most insidious thing in the world is nonsense that sounds just plausible enough to listen to." —Lazav
Murmuring Phantasm.name: Murmuring Phantasm

Opal Lake Gatekeepers.flavor: Sentries guard Ravnica's landmarks and outlying districts, unaware of these places' import to the maze.
Opal Lake Gatekeepers.name: Opal Lake Gatekeepers
Opal Lake Gatekeepers.text: When Opal Lake Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you may draw a card.

Runner's Bane.name: Runner's Bane
Runner's Bane.text:
Enchant creature with power 3 or less
When Runner's Bane enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

Trait Doctoring.name: Trait Doctoring
Trait Doctoring.text:
Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

Uncovered Clues.flavor: The Implicit Maze winds through Ravnica, connecting arcane landmarks of all ten guilds.
Uncovered Clues.name: Uncovered Clues
Uncovered Clues.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal up to two instant and/or sorcery cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

Wind Drake.flavor: Air currents whip through the city corridors, creating wind tunnels that accelerate urban drakes toward their prey.
Wind Drake.name: Wind Drake

Bane Alley Blackguard.flavor: "I'm in the field of procurement, and business is good. The guilds want all kinds of maps and relics these days, though what they want them for I'm not quite sure."
Bane Alley Blackguard.name: Bane Alley Blackguard

Blood Scrivener.flavor: Make sure you bleed the fine print.
Blood Scrivener.name: Blood Scrivener
Blood Scrivener.text: If you would draw a card while you have no cards in hand, instead draw two cards and lose 1 life.

Crypt Incursion.flavor: The Golgari maze-runner Varolz hungers to prove his fortitude in battle, and his trail of victims feeds other hungers.
Crypt Incursion.name: Crypt Incursion
Crypt Incursion.text: Exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard. You gain 3 life for each card exiled this way.

Fatal Fumes.flavor: Travelers in the undercity dread the horrors and assassins of the Dimir, but nearly as many die from more mundane hazards.
Fatal Fumes.name: Fatal Fumes
Fatal Fumes.text: Target creature gets -4/-2 until end of turn.

Hired Torturer.flavor: "Follow your passion, I always say. Might as well get paid to do what you love."
Hired Torturer.name: Hired Torturer
Hired Torturer.text:
Defender
{3}{B}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, then reveals a card at random from their hand.

Maze Abomination.name: Maze Abomination
Maze Abomination.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Multicolored creatures you control have deathtouch.

Pontiff of Blight.name: Pontiff of Blight
Pontiff of Blight.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Other creatures you control have extort. (If a creature has multiple instances of extort, each triggers separately.)

Rakdos Drake.flavor: Rakdos rioters paint their faces to resemble the drakes' bloodied muzzles.
Rakdos Drake.name: Rakdos Drake
Rakdos Drake.text:
Flying
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

Sinister Possession.flavor: "You caught something on a cold night's stroll? No, I'd say something caught you." —Mezim Magrah, civic healer
Sinister Possession.name: Sinister Possession
Sinister Possession.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 2 life.

Ubul Sar Gatekeepers.flavor: There are many gates into the undercity, but few ways out.
Ubul Sar Gatekeepers.name: Ubul Sar Gatekeepers
Ubul Sar Gatekeepers.text: When Ubul Sar Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, target creature an opponent controls gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Awe for the Guilds.flavor: When the guilds cooperate, the guildless celebrate their peaceful society. When the guilds clash, the guildless just try to keep out of the way.
Awe for the Guilds.name: Awe for the Guilds
Awe for the Guilds.text: Monocolored creatures can't block this turn.

Clear a Path.flavor: "Why do guards always look surprised when we bash them?" asked Ruric. "I think they expect a bribe," said Thar.
Clear a Path.name: Clear a Path

Maze Rusher.flavor: "The maze seems to fight us at every turn, resisting our efforts to solve it." —Niv-Mizzet
Maze Rusher.name: Maze Rusher
Maze Rusher.text:
Haste
Multicolored creatures you control have haste.

Possibility Storm.name: Possibility Storm
Possibility Storm.text: Whenever a player casts a spell from their hand, that player exiles it, then exiles cards from the top of their library until they exile a card that shares a card type with it. That player may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then they put all cards exiled with Possibility Storm on the bottom of their library in a random order.

Punish the Enemy.flavor: "When justice descends, the servant will burn with the master." —Aurelia
Punish the Enemy.name: Punish the Enemy
Punish the Enemy.text: Punish the Enemy deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker and 3 damage to target creature.

Pyrewild Shaman.name: Pyrewild Shaman
Pyrewild Shaman.text:
Bloodrush — {1}{R}, Discard Pyrewild Shaman: Target attacking creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, if Pyrewild Shaman is in your graveyard, you may pay {3}. If you do, return Pyrewild Shaman to your hand.

Riot Piker.flavor: He doesn't care whether he's rioting about trade rights or just having a drunken brawl. He wakes up every morning eager to smash some heads.
Riot Piker.name: Riot Piker
Riot Piker.text:
First strike
Riot Piker attacks each combat if able.

Rubblebelt Maaka.flavor: "The maaka remain loyal to us in this time of strife. We don't even have to feed them—our enemies do." —Nedja, Gruul shaman
Rubblebelt Maaka.name: Rubblebelt Maaka
Rubblebelt Maaka.text: Bloodrush — {R}, Discard Rubblebelt Maaka: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Smelt-Ward Gatekeepers.name: Smelt-Ward Gatekeepers
Smelt-Ward Gatekeepers.text: When Smelt-Ward Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

Weapon Surge.name: Weapon Surge
Weapon Surge.text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Overload {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

Battering Krasis.name: Battering Krasis
Battering Krasis.text:
Trample
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

Kraul Warrior.flavor: The insectile kraul lurk in the tunnels below street level. Many are loyal to the Golgari Swarm, but others follow their own esoteric caste system.
Kraul Warrior.name: Kraul Warrior
Kraul Warrior.text: {5}{G}: Kraul Warrior gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Maze Behemoth.flavor: It returned to the leylines as quickly as it had appeared, leaving only broken bodies to mark its passage.
Maze Behemoth.name: Maze Behemoth
Maze Behemoth.text:
Trample
Multicolored creatures you control have trample.

Mending Touch.flavor: "The gift of life must be freely given. Anything less would diminish us all." —Arin, Selesnya healer
Mending Touch.name: Mending Touch

Mutant's Prey.flavor: Every street corner is a hunting ground, every citizen potential prey.
Mutant's Prey.name: Mutant's Prey
Mutant's Prey.text: Target creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

Phytoburst.flavor: Phytohydras are banned as houseplants in many residential spires. If left unfed, they find their own exit—usually at the cost of extensive property damage.
Phytoburst.name: Phytoburst
Phytoburst.text: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.

Renegade Krasis.name: Renegade Krasis
Renegade Krasis.text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Whenever Renegade Krasis evolves, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

Saruli Gatekeepers.flavor: In Ravnica's wilder districts, nature still stirs, and its protectors still mind their posts.
Saruli Gatekeepers.name: Saruli Gatekeepers
Saruli Gatekeepers.text: When Saruli Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you gain 7 life.

Skylasher.flavor: "It preys on those who would spy on our lands, so we never prey on it." —Kroshkar, Gruul shaman
Skylasher.name: Skylasher
Skylasher.text:
Flash
This spell can't be countered.
Reach, protection from blue

Thrashing Mossdog.name: Thrashing Mossdog
Thrashing Mossdog.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Scavenge {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

Advent of the Wurm.flavor: The consciousness of Mat'Selesnya does not always spread in peaceful ways.
Advent of the Wurm.name: Advent of the Wurm
Advent of the Wurm.text: Create a 5/5 green Wurm creature token with trample.

Armored Wolf-Rider.flavor: Wolf-riders of Selesnya apprentice from a young age. Each rider raises a wolf pup from birth to serve as a mount, hoping that one day the two will share the honor of guarding the Great Concourse.
Armored Wolf-Rider.name: Armored Wolf-Rider

Ascended Lawmage.flavor: A lawmage's runic script is an act of governance given form: legislation written directly onto the air itself.
Ascended Lawmage.name: Ascended Lawmage
Ascended Lawmage.text:
Flying
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

Beetleform Mage.flavor: "When the Simic say to take command of your life, we don't mean just your career." —Vorel of the Hull Clade
Beetleform Mage.name: Beetleform Mage
Beetleform Mage.text: {G}{U}: Beetleform Mage gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

Blast of Genius.flavor: Ral Zarek's brainstorms bring actual thunder and lightning.
Blast of Genius.name: Blast of Genius
Blast of Genius.text: Choose any target. Draw three cards, then discard a card. Blast of Genius deals damage equal to the discarded card's converted mana cost to that permanent or player.

Blaze Commando.flavor: A true Boros commando only calls for reinforcements so they can clean up the mess.
Blaze Commando.name: Blaze Commando
Blaze Commando.text: Whenever an instant or sorcery spell you control deals damage, create two 1/1 red and white Soldier creature tokens with haste.

Blood Baron of Vizkopa.name: Blood Baron of Vizkopa
Blood Baron of Vizkopa.text:
Lifelink, protection from white and from black
As long as you have 30 or more life and an opponent has 10 or less life, Blood Baron of Vizkopa gets +6/+6 and has flying.

Boros Battleshaper.flavor: Leaders shape the minds of their allies. It takes a master to shape the minds of enemies.
Boros Battleshaper.name: Boros Battleshaper
Boros Battleshaper.text: At the beginning of each combat, up to one target creature attacks or blocks this combat if able and up to one target creature can't attack or block this combat.

Bred for the Hunt.flavor: Some see the world as a place of infinite wonder and knowledge. Some see it as an infinite dinner plate.
Bred for the Hunt.name: Bred for the Hunt
Bred for the Hunt.text: Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

Bronzebeak Moa.flavor: They fight for their home with more loyalty than any conscript.
Bronzebeak Moa.name: Bronzebeak Moa
Bronzebeak Moa.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Bronzebeak Moa gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Carnage Gladiator.flavor: Not the foulest or bloodiest act at Rix Maadi by a stretch.
Carnage Gladiator.name: Carnage Gladiator
Carnage Gladiator.text:
Whenever a creature blocks, that creature's controller loses 1 life.
{1}{B}{R}: Regenerate Carnage Gladiator.

Council of the Absolute.name: Council of the Absolute
Council of the Absolute.text:
As Council of the Absolute enters the battlefield, choose a noncreature, nonland card name.
Your opponents can't cast spells with the chosen name.
Spells with the chosen name you cast cost {2} less to cast.

Deadbridge Chant.name: Deadbridge Chant
Deadbridge Chant.text:
When Deadbridge Chant enters the battlefield, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

Debt to the Deathless.flavor: Some of Orzhov's cruelest collectors remember their debtors by taste alone.
Debt to the Deathless.name: Debt to the Deathless
Debt to the Deathless.text: Each opponent loses two times X life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

Deputy of Acquittals.name: Deputy of Acquittals
Deputy of Acquittals.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deputy of Acquittals enters the battlefield, you may return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

Dragonshift.name: Dragonshift
Dragonshift.text:
Until end of turn, target creature you control becomes a blue and red Dragon with base power and toughness 4/4, loses all abilities, and gains flying.
Overload {3}{U}{U}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

Drown in Filth.flavor: The rot farmer's first rite of passage is to craft a pair of work stilts.
Drown in Filth.name: Drown in Filth
Drown in Filth.text: Choose target creature. Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard, then that creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each land card in your graveyard.

Emmara Tandris.flavor: When Selesnya needed a champion, Emmara put the ranks of her guild before herself—making her the perfect choice.
Emmara Tandris.name: Emmara Tandris
Emmara Tandris.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creature tokens you control.

Exava, Rakdos Blood Witch.name: Exava, Rakdos Blood Witch
Exava, Rakdos Blood Witch.text:
First strike, haste
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has haste.

Feral Animist.flavor: "Channeling the rage of the beast is the easy part. Explaining why you woke up with no memory in a pile of mangled lawmages—that's trickier."
Feral Animist.name: Feral Animist
Feral Animist.text: {3}: Feral Animist gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.

Fluxcharger.flavor: One part mizzium, two parts elemental energy, eleven parts danger.
Fluxcharger.name: Fluxcharger
Fluxcharger.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may switch Fluxcharger's power and toughness until end of turn.

Gaze of Granite.flavor: Golgari reclaimers resent the gorgons, begrudging the loss of so many fine nutrients locked away in stone.
Gaze of Granite.name: Gaze of Granite
Gaze of Granite.text: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost X or less.

Gleam of Battle.flavor: Every soldier returns from battle changed: by hardship, by blood, by a glimpse of glory.
Gleam of Battle.name: Gleam of Battle
Gleam of Battle.text: Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

Goblin Test Pilot.flavor: "All pilots and prototypes destroyed. Extensive collateral damage inflicted. Conclusion: flawless design." —Manual of Melek
Goblin Test Pilot.name: Goblin Test Pilot
Goblin Test Pilot.text:
Flying
{T}: Goblin Test Pilot deals 2 damage to any target chosen at random.

Gruul War Chant.flavor: "We are the heart of the wild, the fire in its eyes, and the howl in its throat. Come, join the battle to which you were born." —Kroshkar, Gruul shaman
Gruul War Chant.name: Gruul War Chant
Gruul War Chant.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0 and have menace.

Haunter of Nightveil.flavor: The Dimir employ the spirits of Ravnica's ancient, nameless dead, guiding their malevolence toward selected victims.
Haunter of Nightveil.name: Haunter of Nightveil

Jelenn Sphinx.flavor: Few among the Azorius have ever spoken with the sphinxes, but all have felt their influence.
Jelenn Sphinx.name: Jelenn Sphinx
Jelenn Sphinx.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Jelenn Sphinx attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

Korozda Gorgon.name: Korozda Gorgon
Korozda Gorgon.text:
Deathtouch
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

Krasis Incubation.name: Krasis Incubation
Krasis Incubation.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
{1}{G}{U}, Return Krasis Incubation to its owner's hand: Put two +1/+1 counters on enchanted creature.

Lavinia of the Tenth.name: Lavinia of the Tenth
Lavinia of the Tenth.text:
Protection from red
When Lavinia of the Tenth enters the battlefield, detain each nonland permanent your opponents control with converted mana cost 4 or less. (Until your next turn, those permanents can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)

Legion's Initiative.name: Legion's Initiative
Legion's Initiative.text:
Red creatures you control get +1/+0.
White creatures you control get +0/+1.
{R}{W}, Exile Legion's Initiative: Exile all creatures you control. At the beginning of the next combat, return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control and those creatures gain haste until end of turn.

Master of Cruelties.name: Master of Cruelties
Master of Cruelties.text:
First strike, deathtouch
Master of Cruelties can only attack alone.
Whenever Master of Cruelties attacks a player and isn't blocked, that player's life total becomes 1. Master of Cruelties assigns no combat damage this combat.

Maw of the Obzedat.flavor: The devout sacrifice themselves to it hoping for escape from their debts to the guild, but many end up owing in the afterlife.
Maw of the Obzedat.name: Maw of the Obzedat
Maw of the Obzedat.text: Sacrifice a creature: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

Melek, Izzet Paragon.name: Melek, Izzet Paragon
Melek, Izzet Paragon.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may cast the top card of your library if it's an instant or sorcery card.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your library, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker.name: Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker
Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker.text:
Flying
Whenever Mirko Vosk, Mind Drinker deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal four land cards, then puts those cards into their graveyard.

Morgue Burst.flavor: "Let him in. He's on the list." —Olrich, Rakdos club owner
Morgue Burst.name: Morgue Burst
Morgue Burst.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Morgue Burst deals damage to any target equal to the power of the card returned this way.

Nivix Cyclops.name: Nivix Cyclops
Nivix Cyclops.text:
Defender
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Nivix Cyclops gets +3/+0 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

Notion Thief.name: Notion Thief
Notion Thief.text:
Flash
If an opponent would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

Obzedat's Aid.flavor: "The Obzedat have revived you with purpose. Don't squander their blessing." —Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov
Obzedat's Aid.name: Obzedat's Aid
Obzedat's Aid.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Pilfered Plans.flavor: Mirko Vosk hunted anyone with knowledge of the maze, draining the chances of the other guilds.
Pilfered Plans.name: Pilfered Plans
Pilfered Plans.text: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard. Draw two cards.

Plasm Capture.flavor: "Everything serves a purpose. Even you." —Vorel of the Hull Clade
Plasm Capture.name: Plasm Capture
Plasm Capture.text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next precombat main phase, add X mana in any combination of colors, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

Progenitor Mimic.name: Progenitor Mimic
Progenitor Mimic.text: You may have Progenitor Mimic enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, if this creature isn't a token, create a token that's a copy of this creature."

Putrefy.flavor: "We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down." —Cevraya, Golgari shaman
Putrefy.name: Putrefy
Putrefy.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

Ral Zarek.name: Ral Zarek
Ral Zarek.text:
+1: Tap target permanent, then untap another target permanent.
−2: Ral Zarek deals 3 damage to any target.
−7: Flip five coins. Take an extra turn after this one for each coin that comes up heads.

Reap Intellect.name: Reap Intellect
Reap Intellect.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose up to X nonland cards from it and exile them. For each card exiled this way, search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

Render Silent.flavor: "We have confiscated your spells as evidence. Once we conclude our investigation, you may petition to have them returned."
Render Silent.name: Render Silent
Render Silent.text: Counter target spell. Its controller can't cast spells this turn.

Restore the Peace.flavor: "You can always count on the Azorius to ruin a party." —Massacre Girl
Restore the Peace.name: Restore the Peace
Restore the Peace.text: Return each creature that dealt damage this turn to its owner's hand.

Rot Farm Skeleton.name: Rot Farm Skeleton
Rot Farm Skeleton.text:
Rot Farm Skeleton can't block.
{2}{B}{G}, Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard: Return Rot Farm Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

Ruric Thar, the Unbowed.name: Ruric Thar, the Unbowed
Ruric Thar, the Unbowed.text:
Vigilance, reach
Ruric Thar, the Unbowed attacks each combat if able.
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, Ruric Thar deals 6 damage to that player.

Savageborn Hydra.name: Savageborn Hydra
Savageborn Hydra.text:
Double strike
Savageborn Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R/G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Savageborn Hydra. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

Scab-Clan Giant.flavor: For the Gruul, bone-crushing rage is the first priority. Accuracy comes in a distant ninetieth.
Scab-Clan Giant.name: Scab-Clan Giant
Scab-Clan Giant.text: When Scab-Clan Giant enters the battlefield, it fights target creature an opponent controls chosen at random.

Showstopper.flavor: The audience quickly realized a few things: it wasn't a magic trick, there wasn't candy in there, and they'd need new clothes.
Showstopper.name: Showstopper
Showstopper.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "When this creature dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature an opponent controls."

Sin Collector.flavor: "That must weigh heavily on your soul. Let me purge it for you."
Sin Collector.name: Sin Collector
Sin Collector.text: When Sin Collector enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it and exile that card.

Sire of Insanity.flavor: Its victims become mindless lunatics. Conveniently, that's the first step in joining the Cult of Rakdos.
Sire of Insanity.name: Sire of Insanity
Sire of Insanity.text: At the beginning of each end step, each player discards their hand.

Species Gorger.flavor: "We raised eelhawks to control the squidflies, then waspcrabs to prey on the eelhawks. Now what do we do with all these waspcrabs?" —Gulistan, Simic biomancer
Species Gorger.name: Species Gorger
Species Gorger.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

Spike Jester.flavor: For the Rakdos, "suicidal charge" and "good showmanship" are one and the same.
Spike Jester.name: Spike Jester

Tajic, Blade of the Legion.flavor: "I run the maze alone, but I fight with the full might of the Legion."
Tajic, Blade of the Legion.name: Tajic, Blade of the Legion
Tajic, Blade of the Legion.text:
Indestructible
Battalion — Whenever Tajic, Blade of the Legion and at least two other creatures attack, Tajic gets +5/+5 until end of turn.

Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts.name: Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts
Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts.text:
Vigilance, protection from creatures
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, destroy that creature. Create a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying.

Tithe Drinker.name: Tithe Drinker
Tithe Drinker.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)

Trostani's Summoner.name: Trostani's Summoner
Trostani's Summoner.text: When Trostani's Summoner enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance, a 3/3 green Centaur creature token, and a 4/4 green Rhino creature token with trample.

Unflinching Courage.flavor: As Trostani's influence grew, vitality spread through the Conclave—much to the other guilds' dismay.
Unflinching Courage.name: Unflinching Courage
Unflinching Courage.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample and lifelink. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

Varolz, the Scar-Striped.name: Varolz, the Scar-Striped
Varolz, the Scar-Striped.text:
Each creature card in your graveyard has scavenge. The scavenge cost is equal to its mana cost. (Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to that card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)
Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Varolz, the Scar-Striped.

Viashino Firstblade.flavor: "All that steel doesn't make them slower. It makes them bolder." —Tajic, Blade of the Legion
Viashino Firstblade.name: Viashino Firstblade
Viashino Firstblade.text:
Haste
When Viashino Firstblade enters the battlefield, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

Voice of Resurgence.name: Voice of Resurgence
Voice of Resurgence.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell during your turn or when Voice of Resurgence dies, create a green and white Elemental creature token with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control."

Vorel of the Hull Clade.flavor: "I used to hurl rocks and eat scraps of meat burned over a fire. Look at what I've become and tell me Simic does not hold infinite possibility."
Vorel of the Hull Clade.name: Vorel of the Hull Clade
Vorel of the Hull Clade.text: {G}{U}, {T}: Double the number of each kind of counter on target artifact, creature, or land.

Warleader's Helix.flavor: "There is no time to remedy our enemies' ignorance. Blast it out of them." —Aurelia
Warleader's Helix.name: Warleader's Helix
Warleader's Helix.text: Warleader's Helix deals 4 damage to any target and you gain 4 life.

Warped Physique.flavor: The Gruul seek unbounded strength. The Dimir deliver cruel irony.
Warped Physique.name: Warped Physique
Warped Physique.text: Target creature gets +X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

Woodlot Crawler.flavor: "We learned something from the Simic. Unfortunately for them." —Nefara, Dimir agent
Woodlot Crawler.name: Woodlot Crawler
Woodlot Crawler.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
Protection from green

Zhur-Taa Ancient.flavor: Many Ravnicans think of nature as orderly groves and elf-tended rot farms. They haven't seen the Gruul wilds.
Zhur-Taa Ancient.name: Zhur-Taa Ancient
Zhur-Taa Ancient.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.

Zhur-Taa Druid.flavor: "Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."
Zhur-Taa Druid.name: Zhur-Taa Druid
Zhur-Taa Druid.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

Well.name: Well
Well.text:
You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Alive.text:
Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.

All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains double strike until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Call.text:
Create four 1/1 white Bird creature tokens with flying.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Beck.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield this turn, you may draw a card.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Entering.text:
Put a creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Breaking.text:
Target player puts the top eight cards of their library into their graveyard.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Release.text:
Each player sacrifices an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, a land, and a planeswalker.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Catch.text:
Gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Dirty.text:
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is the power of the card you exiled.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Take.text:
Remove all +1/+1 counters from target creature you control. Draw that many cards.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Give.name: Give
Give.text:
Put three +1/+1 counters on target creature.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Loss.name: Loss
Loss.text:
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Profit.name: Profit
Profit.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Serve.name: Serve
Serve.text:
Target creature gets -6/-0 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Protect.name: Protect
Protect.text:
Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Willing.text:

Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Ready.name: Ready
Ready.text:

Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

Trouble.name: Trouble
Trouble.text:
Trouble deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

Destroy target enchantment.

Wear.name: Wear

Azorius Cluestone.flavor: Its three sides represent the Sova, judges and arbitrators; the Jelenn, scribes and elocutors; and the Lyev, lawmages and enforcers.
Azorius Cluestone.name: Azorius Cluestone
Azorius Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
{W}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Azorius Cluestone: Draw a card.

Boros Cluestone.flavor: "In case of fire, treachery, citywide riot, political upheaval, or worldwide societal collapse, break glass." —Cluestone inscription
Boros Cluestone.name: Boros Cluestone
Boros Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.
{R}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Boros Cluestone: Draw a card.

Dimir Cluestone.flavor: It waits in the chill of the undercity, holding nameless secrets for those who dare to touch it.
Dimir Cluestone.name: Dimir Cluestone
Dimir Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
{U}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Dimir Cluestone: Draw a card.

Golgari Cluestone.flavor: Golgari mold collects whispers, intelligence that is later harvested by Jarad and his high chancellors.
Golgari Cluestone.name: Golgari Cluestone
Golgari Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.
{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Golgari Cluestone: Draw a card.

Gruul Cluestone.flavor: Forgotten under rocks and vines, Gruul symbols mark the sites of primitive rituals where shamans once chanted to the wild.
Gruul Cluestone.name: Gruul Cluestone
Gruul Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.
{R}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Gruul Cluestone: Draw a card.

Izzet Cluestone.flavor: It holds within it an unsolvable riddle. A creative answer yields an invitation to the guild.
Izzet Cluestone.name: Izzet Cluestone
Izzet Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.
{U}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Izzet Cluestone: Draw a card.

Orzhov Cluestone.flavor: A symbol of power and wealth, the only commodities that matter to the Orzhov.
Orzhov Cluestone.name: Orzhov Cluestone
Orzhov Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Orzhov Cluestone: Draw a card.

Rakdos Cluestone.name: Rakdos Cluestone
Rakdos Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
{B}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Rakdos Cluestone: Draw a card.

Selesnya Cluestone.flavor: "Break it if you must. The loss of one relic is nothing next to the value of enriching us all." —Suniel the Woodwise
Selesnya Cluestone.name: Selesnya Cluestone
Selesnya Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.
{G}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Selesnya Cluestone: Draw a card.

Simic Cluestone.flavor: Simic symbols are among the most intricate and fragile, yet few vandalize them for fear of the strange lifeforms that might be released.
Simic Cluestone.name: Simic Cluestone
Simic Cluestone.text:
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
{G}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Simic Cluestone: Draw a card.

Azorius Guildgate.flavor: The Azorius symbol stares down like a great eye, reminding visitors of the watchful presence of Isperia and her lawmages.
Azorius Guildgate.name: Azorius Guildgate
Azorius Guildgate.text:
Azorius Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

Boros Guildgate.flavor: It promises protection to those in need and proclaims a warning to any who would threaten Ravnican law.
Boros Guildgate.name: Boros Guildgate
Boros Guildgate.text:
Boros Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.

Dimir Guildgate.flavor: In the cold corridors of the undercity, misinformation unfurls from Duskmantle like a spreading stain.
Dimir Guildgate.name: Dimir Guildgate
Dimir Guildgate.text:
Dimir Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.

Golgari Guildgate.flavor: Every part of the gate was reclaimed from forgotten ruins and imbued with new purpose by the Swarm.
Golgari Guildgate.name: Golgari Guildgate
Golgari Guildgate.text:
Golgari Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.

Gruul Guildgate.flavor: The scarred rubble around the gate is testament to past meetings of the Clans, summits that inevitably devolved into brawls.
Gruul Guildgate.name: Gruul Guildgate
Gruul Guildgate.text:
Gruul Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.

Izzet Guildgate.flavor: Beyond lies the culmination of all Izzet projects, a grand experiment led by the dragon Niv-Mizzet himself.
Izzet Guildgate.name: Izzet Guildgate
Izzet Guildgate.text:
Izzet Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.

Maze's End.name: Maze's End
Maze's End.text:
Maze's End enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}, Return Maze's End to its owner's hand: Search your library for a Gate card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If you control ten or more Gates with different names, you win the game.

Orzhov Guildgate.flavor: "We do not believe in hiding our wealth in the shadows. This is Orzhov, and this is how we reward greatness." —Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov
Orzhov Guildgate.name: Orzhov Guildgate
Orzhov Guildgate.text:
Orzhov Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

Rakdos Guildgate.flavor: Maze-runners who pass through the Rakdos gate leave behind their scruples and a significant amount of skin.
Rakdos Guildgate.name: Rakdos Guildgate
Rakdos Guildgate.text:
Rakdos Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.

Selesnya Guildgate.flavor: The Selesyna welcome all to help them heal the city's wounds. The price, however, is devotion to the guild and a selfless belief in Trostani.
Selesnya Guildgate.name: Selesnya Guildgate
Selesnya Guildgate.text:
Selesnya Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.

Simic Guildgate.flavor: Simic biomancers don't concern themselves with guarding a gate. Their ever-present creations are enough to ward off trespassers.
Simic Guildgate.name: Simic Guildgate
Simic Guildgate.text:
Simic Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
